title: Residence Inn Montreal Downtown Re-opens After Multi-million Dollar Renovation
text: MONTREAL , July 16, 2015 /PRNewswire/ - Celebrating the completion of a multi-million dollar renovation, Residence Inn by Marriott Montreal Downtown has re-opened and invites travellers to experience a renewed sense of well-being through the harmony of cozy rooms and modern technologies. (Photo: http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20150716/237856) Whether travelling for business, pleasure, or both, guests will be amazed by the transformation from the moment they walk through the front doors. Every space at this hotel has been transformed from floor to ceiling, with new carpet, floor tiles, wall vinyl, furnishings, appliances, technology, artwork and d√©cor. "We're beyond excited to be open again and our guest response has been exceptional," said Marco Carelli , general manager of Residence Inn Montreal Downtown. "Our returning guests are thrilled with the transformation and our new modern look - and we've enjoyed meeting many new first-time guests who love how welcome they've been made to feel by all of our incredible associates."The lobby not only offers a chic, comfortable space to relax and socialize during a stay, but also features an elegant and cozy fireplace to make it feel just like home. The Hearth Room offers a healthy and hearty hot breakfast buffet with new floor-to-ceiling windows that look out onto Peel Street. Sweetening guests' travel experience, the downtown Montreal hotel embraces that warm, contemporary feel in all of its redesigned studios and suites while boosting energy efficiency with new windows that reduce sound and let in plenty of natural light. Travellers will be greeted by rich, chocolate brown furnishings and neutral wall colors, accented with a touch of teal to add pop and sophistication. Elegant cabinetry and new stainless-steel appliances now adorn the fully equipped kitchens, giving guests everything they need for an extended stay. Superior bedding with feather and foam pillows and stylish light fixtures complement modern technologies including flat-panel TVs and complimentary high-speed Internet access. The bathrooms in all guest suites also received a complete facelift, appealing to today's travellers with quartz countertops on dark wood cabinets, space-saving glass shelves for personal items, glass-enclosed showers and new ceramic tile. 1 of 2
